poem:
Title: A Dark Vein in Our Collective Body

Shame, like a fever, boils in the vast body politic,
A sorry pus of regrets bursts forth –
The crimson stream tainted, innocent lives blighted.
In this cold, sterile house, mistruths breed rampant. 
Who knew not of the existing venom,
Pervasive, subtle, chilling for countless seasons?
Through the corridors of power, echoes the belated apology,
Hang your heads, actors in this avoidable tragedy.
